description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the Windows Resource Manager PSM service extension elevation of privilege vulnerability (CVE-2024-38137):

1. Download and apply the following updates relevant to your Windows version:
   - For Windows 11 Version 24H2: [KB5041571](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041571)
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2: [KB5041585](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041585)
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2: [KB5041585](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041585)
   - For Windows 11 Version 21H2: [KB5041592](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041592)
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2: [KB5041580](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041580)
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2: [KB5041580](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041580)
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2 (32-bit): [KB5041580](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041580)

2. Restart your system after installation to ensure the updates take effect.

**Details**:
- This update resolves issues related to sensitive data storage and improper synchronization, effectively mitigating the risk of privilege escalation.
- Ensure the system is on a supported version of Windows prior to applying the updates.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the update installation.

**Key Build Numbers Affected**:
- Windows 11 Version 24H2 for x64-based Systems: 10.0.26100.1457
- Windows 10 Version 22H2 for x64-based Systems: 10.0.19045.4780 (LLM Synthesized)
